_description: KSAU v24.0 Extended Survey Dataset — Session 4 (R-1, R-2 compliance)
_note: Added ACT-DR6 CMB lensing and Planck PR4 CMB lensing for ≥5 survey requirement
_ssot: All values from published measurements. No hardcoded theory values.
_ordered_by_k_eff: Planck PR4 (0.07) < ACT-DR6 (0.09) < DES Y3 (0.15) < HSC Y3 (0.35) < KiDS-Legacy (0.70)

Planck PR4 Lensing.notes: Planck PR4 CMB lensing reconstruction. High-z probe: k_eff ~0.07 h/Mpc, z_eff~2 (lensing kernel).

ACT-DR6.ref: Qu et al. (2023), arXiv:2304.05202; Madhavacheril et al. (2024)
ACT-DR6.notes: ACT Data Release 6 CMB lensing. k_eff ~0.09 h/Mpc, z_eff~1.7.

DES Y3.notes: DES Year 3 cosmic shear. Existing survey from v23.0/v24.0 analysis.

HSC Y3.notes: Hyper Suprime-Cam Year 3 cosmic shear. Existing survey.

KiDS-Legacy.notes: KiDS-1000 Legacy cosmic shear. Existing survey.

expected_leech_assignment._note: IF R_base = 3/(2*kappa) = 11.459 Mpc/h (SSoT), expected R0 = R_base * shell_mag

k_eff_shell_ordering_principle.statement: k_eff ∝ 1/R0 = 1/(R_base × shell_mag) — larger k_eff survey → smaller shell index
k_eff_shell_ordering_principle.derivation: R0(i) = R_base × shell_mag(n_i). Survey effective scale k_eff(i) ~ 1/r_z(i) = (1+z_eff)^beta / R0(i). Therefore k_eff(i) ∝ 1/shell_mag(n_i), implying anti-correlation: larger k_eff → smaller shell magnitude → smaller shell index.
k_eff_shell_ordering_principle.r3_status: First-principles motivated (qualitative); quantitative derivation pending Section 2 Λ integration
